shortDesc:
GIVEN there is an HTML-single-line-comment beginning with 'Aliases:'
AND aliases contain unicode word characters
THEN they MUST still be separated correctly
longDesc:
GIVEN there is an HTML-single-line-comment beginning with 'Aliases:'
AND aliases contain unicode word characters
THEN they MUST still be separated correctly

shortDesc: foo
longDesc: foo

shortDesc:
GIVEN a term "FIELD"
AND an alias "GREENFIELD" WHERE the alias ends with the term
THEN the alias MUST still be linked to the term, correctly.
longDesc:
GIVEN a term "FIELD"
AND an alias "GREENFIELD" WHERE the alias ends with the term
THEN the alias MUST still be linked to the term, correctly.

THEN the alias MUST still be linked to the term, correctly.

GIVEN a term "Flower"
AND an alias "lower" WHERE the term ends with the alias
THEN the alias MUST still be linked to the term, correctly.

THEN the alias MUST be linked to the term, correctly.

AND an alias "end" WHERE the term includes the alias
THEN the alias MUST be linked to the term, correctly.

shortDesc: THEN short description MUST be detected completely.
term: GIVEN full description is a blockquote

shortDesc:
GIVEN a term "Hopefully"
AND an alias "Hope" WHERE the term begins with the alias
THEN the alias MUST still be linked to the term, correctly.
longDesc:
GIVEN a term "Hopefully"
AND an alias "Hope" WHERE the term begins with the alias
THEN the alias MUST still be linked to the term, correctly.

AND an alias "Issues" WHERE the alias begins with the term
THEN the alias MUST still be linked to the term, correctly.
longDesc:
GIVEN a term "Issue"
AND an alias "Issues" WHERE the alias begins with the term
THEN the alias MUST still be linked to the term, correctly.

shortDesc: Lorem ipsum is the worlds most famous, most beloved piece of nonsense.
longDesc:
Lorem ipsum is the worlds most famous, most beloved piece of nonsense. It's
the best of literature. A poem dedicated to space - space that's seamingly
waiting to be filled with something meaningful even though Lorem ipsum is
already meaningful because it only exists due to space being already filled
with life on a tiny planet earth.

shortDesc:
GIVEN a term "OUR"
AND an alias "FLOURISH" WHERE the alias includes the term
THEN the alias MUST still be linked to the term, correctly.
longDesc:
GIVEN a term "OUR"
AND an alias "FLOURISH" WHERE the alias includes the term
THEN the alias MUST still be linked to the term, correctly.

shortDesc:
GIVEN a single sentence accross multiple lines
THEN short description must be extracted correctly
AND long description MUST be the same.
longDesc:
GIVEN a single sentence accross multiple lines
THEN short description must be extracted correctly
AND long description MUST be the same.

shortDesc: GIVEN a single sentence terminated by an exclamation mark THEN short description AND long description MUST be the same!
term: Single sentence terminated by exclamation mark
longDesc: GIVEN a single sentence terminated by an exclamation mark THEN short description AND long description MUST be the same!

shortDesc: GIVEN a single sentence terminated by a fullstop THEN short description AND long description MUST be the same.
term: Single sentence terminated by full stop
longDesc: GIVEN a single sentence terminated by a fullstop THEN short description AND long description MUST be the same.

shortDesc: GIVEN a single sentence terminated by a question mark THEN short description AND long description MUST be the same?
term: Single sentence terminated by question mark
longDesc: GIVEN a single sentence terminated by a question mark THEN short description AND long description MUST be the same?

shortDesc:
GIVEN there is an HTML-single-line-comment beginning with 'Aliases:' THEN the
subsequent comma-separated words MUST be detected as the term's aliases.
longDesc:
GIVEN there is an HTML-single-line-comment beginning with 'Aliases:' THEN the
subsequent comma-separated words MUST be detected as the term's aliases.

shortDesc:
GIVEN there is an HTML-multi-line-comment beginning with 'Aliases:' THEN the
subsequent comma-separated words MUST be detected as the term's aliases.
longDesc:
GIVEN there is an HTML-multi-line-comment beginning with 'Aliases:' THEN the
subsequent comma-separated words MUST be detected as the term's aliases.

shortDesc:
GIVEN there is an HTML-multi-line-comment beginning with 'Aliases:' THEN the
subsequent comma-separated lines of words MUST be detected as the term's aliases.
longDesc:
GIVEN there is an HTML-multi-line-comment beginning with 'Aliases:' THEN the
subsequent comma-separated lines of words MUST be detected as the term's aliases.

shortDesc:
GIVEN there is an HTML-multi-line-comment beginning with 'Aliases:' and an empty
line THEN the subsequent comma-separated lines of words MUST be detected as the
term's aliases.
longDesc:
GIVEN there is an HTML-multi-line-comment beginning with 'Aliases:' and an empty
line THEN the subsequent comma-separated lines of words MUST be detected as the
term's aliases.

shortDesc:
GIVEN there is an HTML-single-line-comment beginning with 'Aliases:'
AND the comment ends with a trailing comma
THEN this MUST NOT result in an infinite loop or out-of-memory error
as has been reported in #26
longDesc:
GIVEN there is an HTML-single-line-comment beginning with 'Aliases:'
AND the comment ends with a trailing comma
THEN this MUST NOT result in an infinite loop or out-of-memory error
as has been reported in #26

shortDesc:
GIVEN two sentences terminated by fullstop THEN short description MUST be the
first sentence.
term: Two sentences accross multiple lines terminated by full stop
longDesc:
GIVEN two sentences terminated by fullstop THEN short description MUST be the
first sentence. AND long description MUST be the first and
second sentence.

shortDesc: GIVEN two sentences terminated by fullstop THEN short description MUST be the first sentence.
term: Two sentences in a single line terminated by full stop
longDesc: GIVEN two sentences terminated by fullstop THEN short description MUST be the first sentence. AND long description MUST be the first and second sentence.

shortDesc: GIVEN two sentences terminated by fullstop THEN short description MUST be the first sentence.
term: Two sentences in multiple lines terminated by full stop
longDesc:
GIVEN two sentences terminated by fullstop THEN short description MUST be the first sentence.
AND long description MUST be the first and second sentence.
